archetypes.name: Family AirFryer Quick Bites
archetypes.description: Ultra-fast, kid-friendly family dinners built around the air fryer with semi-prepared components and fresh add-ons for tacos, wraps, bowls, and crispy mains with quick sides.
archetypes.rationale: Adds the missing Under15, AirFryer-driven family option with mild flavors and semi-prepared ease, complementing existing 15–30 stovetop/oven and hands-off slow-cooker archetypes without overlap.

meals.name: Air Fryer Chicken Nugget Nacho Platter
meals.description: Crispy air-fried chicken nuggets piled over cheesy nachos with mild toppings. Fast, shareable, and kid-friendly for a busy family night.
prep_steps: Preheat air fryer to 200°C/390°F.
Set a large microwave-safe platter or dish for the nachos.
Drain and rinse black beans.
Thinly slice spring onion.
Grate cheddar cheese if not pre-shredded.
cook_steps: Air-fry chicken nuggets for 8–10 minutes until hot and crisp.
Spread nachos on the microwave-safe platter.
Scatter black beans over the chips and sprinkle cheddar cheese.
Microwave 45–60 seconds until the cheese melts.
Slice the cooked chicken nuggets into bite-size pieces and place over the nachos.
Spoon salsa and sour cream over the top, add small dollops of avocado dip, and finish with spring onion.
Serve immediately and let everyone scoop their portion.

meals.name: Air Fryer Chicken Strip Soft Tacos
meals.description: Crispy air-fried chicken strips stuffed into warm tortillas with mild salsa, lettuce, cheese, and creamy toppings. Fast family tacos built from semi-prepped components.
prep_steps: Preheat air fryer to 200°C/390°F.
Place tortillas in a microwave-safe plate and cover lightly to prevent drying.
Shred lettuce if needed.
Grate cheddar cheese if using a block.
Drain black beans.
cook_steps: Air fry chicken strips for 6–8 minutes until hot and crisp; shake basket halfway.
Microwave the tortillas for 20–30 seconds to warm.
Microwave black beans with half of the salsa for 60–90 seconds until hot; stir.
Assemble tacos: add chicken strips to tortillas, spoon on warm beans, top with lettuce and cheddar cheese.
Finish with remaining salsa, guacamole, and sour cream. Serve immediately.

archetypes.name: Family Extra-Hot Chili Night (Caribbean & Mexican, 15–30, Simple)
archetypes.description: Blazing, pepper-forward family dinners featuring Caribbean and Mexican favorites—jerk-style grills, chile-laced tacos, and peppery rice-and-bean plates—built fast with straightforward steps.
archetypes.rationale: Adds an ExtraHot, quick-and-simple family option in undercovered Caribbean cuisine space without overlapping existing mild/medium/hot archetypes.

meals.name: Extra-Hot Habanero Jerk Chicken & Black Bean Rice Bowls
meals.description: Caribbean jerk-style chicken meets Mexican black beans over fluffy rice with a blazing habanero-hot finish. Fast, family-friendly assembly with big pepper heat.
prep_steps: Rinse and drain 1.5 cups jasmine rice.
Finely chop 1–2 habanero peppers (use gloves).
Slice 1 onion and 2 bell peppers into thin strips.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Juice 1 lime and cut extra wedges if desired.
Drain and rinse 1 can black beans.

In a bowl, combine chicken thighs (sliced) with allspice, oregano, ground cumin, brown sugar, salt, black pepper, half the chopped habanero, half the garlic, lime juice, and 1.5 tbsp olive oil; toss to coat.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add jasmine rice to a pot with 2.25 cups water and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, cover, and simmer on low 12–15 minutes until tender. Rest covered 5 minutes.

Cook chicken (OutdoorGrill or StoveTop): Heat grill to medium-high or a large skillet over medium-high with 1 tbsp olive oil. Cook marinated chicken 6–8 minutes until browned and cooked through, stirring or flipping for even color.

Sauté veg and beans: In the same skillet (add 0.5 tbsp olive oil if needed), cook onion and bell peppers 3–4 minutes until tender-crisp. Add remaining garlic, remaining chopped habanero, and black beans; cook 1–2 minutes to heat through. Season with salt to taste.
Assemble bowls: Fluff rice and divide into 4 bowls. Top with chicken, the pepper-bean mix, and spoon over salsa.
Finish: Drizzle hot sauce to taste. Garnish with chopped coriander and lime wedges.

meals.name: Extra-Hot Chipotle Beef & Black Bean Tacos with Pineapple-Habanero Salsa
meals.description: Fiery chipotle beef and black beans tucked in warm tortillas, topped with a fresh pineapple-habanero salsa for a Caribbean-Mexican heat punch. Built fast for a spicy family taco night.
prep_steps: Dice onion.
Slice bell peppers into thin strips.
Mince garlic.
Finely dice pineapple and tomatoes for salsa.
Finely chop jalapenos and coriander.
Cut lime into wedges (reserve 1 for juice).
Warm tortillas: stack and wrap in foil for the grill, or cover to warm in a dry pan later.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onion and bell peppers; cook 3–4 minutes until softened.
Add ground beef; break up and brown 4–5 minutes.
Stir in garlic, chilli powder, allspice, and salt; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add chipotle sauce and black beans; stir and simmer 2–3 minutes to thicken.
Make salsa in a bowl: combine pineapple, tomatoes, jalapenos, coriander, lime juice, a pinch of salt, and habanero sauce to taste.
Warm tortillas on OutdoorGrill 30–60 seconds per side (or in a dry skillet on the StoveTop) until pliable.
Assemble tacos: fill tortillas with beef-bean mixture and top with pineapple-habanero salsa. Serve with extra lime wedges.

archetypes.name: Family Heat Lovers: Korean & Latin American Feasts (Hot, 30–60, Advanced)
archetypes.description: Bold, spicy family dinners with Korean and Latin American flavors—multi-component plates (marinated proteins, quick pickles/salsas, rice or veg sides) built from scratch in 30–60 minutes for confident home cooks.
archetypes.rationale: Adds an Advanced, Hot-heat family archetype with new Korean and Latin American cuisines and 30–60 minute builds—filling gaps not covered by the existing mild/no-heat, simple, and showstopper entries.

meals.name: Gochujang-Grilled Chicken with Chimichurri and Charred Corn Rice
meals.description: Hot gochujang-marinated chicken grilled and topped with bright chimichurri, served with charred-corn jasmine rice and a crunchy chilli-vinegar cabbage slaw. A Korean–Latin mashup built from scratch with bold heat.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice under cold water until it runs mostly clear; drain well.
Trim 900 g chicken thighs and pat dry.
In a bowl, combine 3 tbsp gochujang, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp sesame oil (divided later), 1 tbsp brown sugar, 2 cloves garlic minced, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, and zest of 1 lime; mix into a paste.
Toss chicken thighs in the gochujang paste to coat; marinate 15–20 minutes at room temperature.
Thinly slice 4 spring onion; set green tops aside for garnish.
Shred 1/2 small cabbage (about 4 cups).
Halve the lime and reserve for squeezing.
Preheat Outdoor Grill to medium-high heat. Place a medium saucepan with lid on the StoveTop.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice, 2 1/2 cups water, and a big pinch of salt to the saucepan. Bring to a boil, stir once, cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest covered 10 minutes.

Char corn: Heat 1 tbsp canola oil in a large skillet on the StoveTop (or a grill basket on the Outdoor Grill). Add 1 1/2 cups corn, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Cook 4–6 minutes until lightly charred. Stir in half of the sliced spring onion whites; remove from heat.
Grill chicken: Oil grill grates with 1 tsp canola oil. Grill marinated chicken thighs 5–6 minutes per side, until cooked through and lightly charred (juices run clear). Rest 5 minutes.

Make slaw: In a large bowl, toss shredded cabbage with 2 tbsp apple cider vinegar, juice of 1/2 lime, 1 tsp chilli flakes, a pinch of salt, and 1 tsp sesame oil. Add remaining spring onion whites; toss again.
Finish rice: Fluff rice with a fork. Fold in charred corn mixture, 1 tsp sesame oil, and a squeeze of lime. Adjust salt to taste.
Serve: Slice or leave chicken thighs whole. Spoon chimichurri over the chicken. Sprinkle with spring onion greens and sesame seeds. Plate with charred-corn rice and a side of chilli-vinegar slaw.

meals.name: Gochujang Ribeye with Mango-Habanero Salsa, Cucumber Quick Pickle, and Jasmine Rice
meals.description: Charred, gochujang-glazed ribeye meets a bright mango-habanero salsa and a snappy cucumber quick pickle over fluffy jasmine rice. A bold Korean–Latin American family feast with real heat.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice under cold water until mostly clear; drain.
Peel and dice mango (small cubes).
Finely mince 1–2 habanero peppers (remove seeds for slightly less heat).
Roughly chop coriander.
Thinly slice cucumber into rounds.
Mince garlic.
Slice spring onion.
In a bowl, whisk gochujang, soy sauce, brown sugar, sesame oil, minced garlic, and black pepper to make a steak glaze.
Pat dry ribeye steak and lightly oil with canola oil; season both sides with salt and black pepper.
In a small bowl, mix rice vinegar, sugar, and a pinch of salt until dissolved for the pickle brine.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice and water to a pot (about 3 cups water). Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 15 minutes. Rest off heat, covered, 5–10 minutes.
Start quick pickle: Toss cucumber with the vinegar brine and a pinch of chilli flakes. Press down so it’s submerged; chill while you cook.
Preheat an outdoor grill to high heat or heat a heavy stovetop skillet over high until very hot.

Grill/sear steak: Cook ribeye 3–4 minutes per side for medium-rare (thicker steaks may need another minute per side). During the last minute, brush generously with the gochujang glaze on both sides to lacquer.
Rest steak 5–8 minutes on a board; brush with a little more glaze while resting.
Make salsa: In a bowl, combine diced mango, minced habanero, chopped coriander, lime juice, and a pinch of salt. Stir and let sit 2–3 minutes.
Finish rice: Fluff rice with a fork. Fold in sliced spring onion and a light drizzle of sesame oil; season with salt to taste.
Slice steak against the grain.
Plate: Mound jasmine rice, top with sliced gochujang ribeye, spoon over mango-habanero salsa, and add cucumber quick pickle on the side. Sprinkle sesame seeds over steak and rice.

archetypes.name: Family Hands-Off Sheet Pan & Slow Cooker Nights
archetypes.description: Set-and-forget family dinners with zero chili heat using sheet pans and slow cookers, leaning on Greek and Middle Eastern flavors for busy weeknights and relaxed weekends.
archetypes.rationale: Fills a gap by offering family-friendly, no-heat, hands-off meals in the 30–60 and 60+ min ranges with different equipment and cuisines than the existing weeknight classics.

meals.name: Sheet-Pan Lemon-Oregano Chicken with Potatoes, Peppers, and Olives
meals.description: Hands-off Greek–Middle Eastern style roast chicken and vegetables with bright lemon, oregano, and sumac. Everything goes on one tray for an easy family dinner with no chili heat.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F. Line a large sheet pan with foil for easy cleanup.
Scrub potatoes and cut into 2–3 cm chunks.
Seed bell peppers and slice into thick strips.
Peel and slice red onion into wedges.
Mince garlic.
Zest then halve the lemon; cut one half into wedges and reserve the other half for juice.
Rinse and drain olives. Roughly chop parsley.
cook_steps: On the sheet pan, toss potatoes, bell peppers, and red onion with 1 tbsp olive oil, half the minced garlic, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Spread in an even layer.
Roast vegetables for 15 minutes to start them cooking.

While veg roasts, pat chicken thighs dry. In a bowl, mix remaining 1 tbsp olive oil, remaining garlic, lemon zest, 1 tbsp lemon juice, oregano, sumac, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Coat chicken thighs in the mixture.
Remove pan, push vegetables to make space, and nestle chicken thighs on top, skin side up if skin-on.
Return pan to oven and roast 25–30 minutes, until chicken is cooked through (internal temp 74°C/165°F) and potatoes are tender.
Scatter olives over the pan and roast 3 more minutes to warm.
Squeeze remaining lemon over the tray. Sprinkle parsley. Serve with lemon wedges.

Optional slow cooker variation (set-and-forget): Add potatoes, peppers, onion, garlic, olives, and chicken (coated in the same seasoning) to the slow cooker. Cook on High 3–4 hours or Low 6–7 hours until chicken is done and potatoes are tender. Finish with lemon juice and parsley. For crisper edges, broil finished chicken and veg on a sheet pan for 3–5 minutes.

meals.name: Slow Cooker Baharat Beef & Chickpeas with Herbed Couscous
meals.description: Hands-off Middle Eastern–Greek comfort: tender baharat beef and chickpeas simmered in tomatoes, served over lemon-parsley couscous. Mild, family-friendly, and set-and-forget.
prep_steps: Peel and dice onion.
Scrub and slice carrots into 1 cm rounds.
Rinse and drain chickpeas.
Roughly chop parsley.
Cut lemon into wedges; reserve a half for juicing.
Measure baharat, salt, and black pepper.
Have couscous and water ready for later.
cook_steps: Add beef stew meat to the slow cooker.
Add onion, carrots, chickpeas, crushed tomatoes, beef stock, baharat, bay leaves, salt, black pepper, and olive oil. Stir to combine.
Cover and cook on Low for 6–8 hours or on High for 3–4 hours until beef is tender.

15 minutes before serving, bring water to a boil in a pot. Stir in couscous, a pinch of salt, and a drizzle of olive oil if desired, cover, and remove from heat. Rest 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork.
Stir chopped parsley and a squeeze of lemon juice into the couscous. Sprinkle oregano and toss.
If using, stir preserved lemon into the stew and remove bay leaves.
Serve couscous in bowls, top with beef and chickpeas, and add lemon wedges on the side.

archetypes.name: Family High-Protein Dinners (30–60, Mild, Intermediate)
archetypes.description: Protein-forward family dinners that build balanced plates around lean meats, seafood, and plant proteins with mild seasoning in 30–60 minutes.

meals.name: Za’atar Lemon Chicken with Herbed Basmati and Chickpea Tomato Salad
meals.description: Oven-finished za’atar lemon chicken thighs with fluffy herbed basmati rice and a bright chickpea-tomato-cucumber salad. Mild, protein-forward and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F. Position a rack in the center.
Rinse 1.5 cups basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear; drain well.
Peel and finely chop 1 medium onions.
Peel and mince 3 cloves garlic.
Zest 1 lemon, then juice both lemons (about 6 tbsp juice total); keep zest and juice separate.
Roughly chop parsley (about 1/2 cup chopped), divide into two portions.
Dice tomatoes and cucumber into bite-size pieces.
Drain and rinse chickpeas.
cook_steps: In a bowl, combine 2 tbsp olive oil, lemon zest, 3 tbsp lemon juice, minced garlic, za'atar, paprika, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper. Add chicken thigh fillets and toss to coat.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. Sear chicken thigh fillets 2–3 minutes per side until lightly browned.
Transfer skillet to the oven and bake 12–15 minutes until chicken is cooked through (internal temp 74°C/165°F). Rest 5 minutes; spoon pan juices over the chicken.
While chicken bakes, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Sauté chopped onions 3–4 minutes until translucent.

Add drained basmati rice to the pan; stir 1 minute to coat. Pour in chicken stock, add a pinch of salt (to taste), bring to a boil, then reduce to low. Cover and simmer 12 minutes. Remove from heat and steam covered 5 minutes.
Fluff rice with a fork; fold in half the chopped parsley and a pinch of black pepper.
Make the salad: In a bowl, combine chickpeas, tomatoes, cucumber, remaining chopped parsley, 2 tbsp olive oil, 3 tbsp lemon juice, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Toss to coat.
Plate herbed basmati rice, top with za’atar lemon chicken and pan juices, and serve salad on the side.

meals.name: Lemon-Herbed Beef and Broccoli Orzo Skillet
meals.description: Tender beef sirloin and broccoli fold into a lemony, garlic-herb orzo for a balanced, protein-forward family skillet. Mild flavors, hearty texture, ready in under an hour.
prep_steps: Cut broccoli into small florets; peel stems and slice thin.
Mince garlic.
Zest and halve lemon; juice one half and reserve the other for wedges if desired.
Slice beef sirloin steak thinly across the grain; pat dry.
Finely chop parsley.
Warm chicken stock in a saucepan on low (helps the orzo cook evenly).
cook_steps: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large deep skillet over medium-high.
Season beef with salt and black pepper; sear in two batches 1–2 minutes per side until just browned. Transfer to a plate (it will finish later).
Reduce heat to medium; add remaining 1 tbsp olive oil to the same skillet. Add orzo and toast 2 minutes, stirring.
Add garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in warm chicken stock and sprinkle in italian seasoning. Stir, bring to a gentle simmer, then reduce heat to medium-low.
Cook orzo uncovered 8–10 minutes, stirring occasionally so it doesn’t stick.
Scatter broccoli over the orzo, cover the skillet, and steam 5–6 minutes until broccoli is tender-crisp and orzo is al dente. If pan looks dry before orzo is done, add a splash of stock or water.
Return seared beef and any juices to the pan; fold through for 1–2 minutes to warm and finish cooking.
Stir in lemon zest and lemon juice; season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Turn off heat, sprinkle parsley, rest 2 minutes, then serve.

archetypes.name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Indian Feast Night
archetypes.description: Presentation-forward Indian family dinners—layered biryanis, tandoori-style roasts, festival curries with chutneys and raita—that reward slow, careful cooking for a memorable weekend spread.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a non-Western weekend showstopper with medium heat and long build time—coverage not met by the existing Spanish/Portuguese-only showstopper—while staying Family + None scope.

meals.name: Saffron Chicken Dum Biryani with Cucumber Raita
meals.description: A layered chicken biryani sealed and baked on dum with saffron milk, fried onions, and herbs, served with a cooling cucumber raita. Weekend showstopper with medium heat and classic Indian flavors.
prep_steps: Rinse basmati rice under cold water until it runs clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Warm milk slightly and crumble saffron into it; set aside to bloom.
Slice onions thinly.
Chop coriander and mint.
Mince garlic.
Cut cucumber into small dice for raita.
In a bowl, combine yoghurt, lemon juice, salt, turmeric powder, garam masala, chili flakes, and minced garlic; add chicken thighs and coat well. Marinate 30–60 minutes refrigerated.
Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F.
Mix flour with enough water to form a pliable rope for sealing the pot lid; cover to prevent drying.
cook_steps: Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add salt and a bay leaf. Add soaked basmati rice and cook until 70% done (grains still firm), about 5–6 minutes. Drain and spread to steam off.

Heat ghee with a little canola oil in a heavy oven-safe pot over medium heat. Fry sliced onions, stirring, until deep golden and crisp at edges. Remove half to a plate for layering; leave the rest in the pot.
Add cumin seeds, peppercorns, cardamom, cloves, cinnamon, and a bay leaf to the pot; toast 30–45 seconds until aromatic.
Increase heat to medium-high. Add marinated chicken thighs and any marinade; sear 2–3 minutes per side until lightly browned.
Reduce heat to medium. Cook chicken with lid ajar 8–10 minutes, stirring once, until just starting to release juices.
Turn heat off. Scatter half the chopped mint and coriander over the chicken, then half the reserved fried onions.
Layer par-cooked rice evenly over the chicken. Drizzle saffron milk over the rice and dot with a little ghee. Top with remaining fried onions and remaining herbs.
Run the flour rope around the pot rim, press on the lid to seal. Transfer to oven and bake 35–40 minutes.
Rest 10 minutes out of the oven, then break the seal. Gently fluff, lifting chicken and rice together to keep layers distinct.
For the raita: In a bowl, mix yoghurt, diced cucumber, ground cumin, a pinch of salt, and chopped mint. Serve alongside the biryani.

meals.name: Tandoori-Style Whole Chicken with Cashew Korma Gravy and Jeera Saffron Rice
meals.description: A centerpiece roasted whole chicken in a yoghurt-spice marinade, served with a rich cashew-coconut korma gravy and fragrant cumin-saffron basmati rice. A family-style Indian feast built for weekend showtime.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/390°F. Set a rack in the middle.
Rinse basmati rice in cold water until it runs mostly clear; soak in fresh water for 20 minutes.
Soak cashews in hot water for 20 minutes; drain.
In a bowl, whisk yoghurt, lemon juice, oil, garlic (minced), salt, paprika, cayenne pepper, turmeric powder, and garam masala to make the marinade.
Pat the whole chicken dry with paper towels. Using a small knife, score shallow slashes in the thighs and breasts.
Thinly slice onions. Pick mint leaves.
Bloom saffron in 2 tablespoons warm water and set aside.
cook_steps: Rub the yoghurt marinade all over and under the skin of the whole chicken. Place on a rack over a roasting tray. Roast 20 minutes at 200°C/390°F.
Reduce oven to 180°C/355°F and continue roasting 45–60 minutes, basting twice with tray juices, until juices run clear and internal temp reaches 75°C/167°F. Rest 10–15 minutes.
While chicken roasts, make the cashew korma base: In a pot over medium heat, add 1 tablespoon ghee. Add sliced onions with a pinch of salt and cook 12–15 minutes until deeply golden.
Add garlic (minced) and cook 1 minute. Stir in cumin, coriander, chili flakes, turmeric powder, and garam masala; cook 30 seconds.

Add drained cashews and coconut milk. Simmer 5 minutes. Blend until smooth (carefully) and return to the pot. Adjust with water for a pourable gravy. Season with salt, lemon juice, and a pinch of sugar to balance. Keep warm on low.
Cook the jeera saffron rice: Drain soaked basmati rice. In a saucepan, heat 1 tablespoon ghee over medium. Add cumin seeds and bay leaves; sizzle 30 seconds until fragrant.

Add rice and stir 1 minute to coat. Add water (about 1.5 cups per cup of rice), saffron water, and salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce to low. Cook 12 minutes; rest off heat 10 minutes, then fluff.
Carve the rested chicken. Spoon cashew korma gravy onto a platter, nestle chicken pieces over, and drizzle more gravy on top.
Garnish with mint. Serve with jeera saffron rice on the side.

archetypes.description: Fast, keto-friendly family dinners built around lean proteins, leafy or cruciferous veg, and rich but simple sauces—no grains, sugars, or starchy sides—using approachable Greek, Middle Eastern, and American flavors.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a missing Family keto archetype with mild heat and 15–30 minute simplicity, complementing existing low-carb/high-protein sets and avoiding overlap with prior cuisines and formats.

meals.name: Greek Lemon-Oregano Chicken Thighs with Zucchini and Tzatziki
meals.description: Pan-seared, oven-finished chicken thighs with lemon, oregano, and garlic, served over sautéed zucchini and topped with tzatziki and feta. Mild, keto-friendly flavors for a quick family dinner.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C/400°F.
Pat dry the chicken thigh fillets with paper towels.
Zucchini: trim ends and slice into half-moons about 1 cm thick.
Mince the garlic.
Zest and juice the lemon; cut remaining lemon into wedges.
Crumble the feta cheese.
Chop the parsley.
cook_steps: Season chicken on both sides with salt, black pepper, half the oregano, half the minced garlic, and half the lemon zest.
Heat an oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat with 1 tbsp olive oil. Sear chicken 3–4 minutes per side until golden.
Transfer skillet to the oven and cook 8–10 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Rest 3 minutes.
While chicken bakes, heat a large pan over medium heat with 1 tbsp olive oil. Add remaining garlic and sauté 30 seconds.
Add zucchini, remaining oregano, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Sauté 3–4 minutes until just tender; remove from heat and toss with remaining lemon zest and half the lemon juice.
Slice chicken if desired. Plate zucchini, top with chicken, spoon tzatziki over, and scatter feta and parsley.
Finish with a light sprinkle of sumac and a squeeze of lemon to taste.

meals.name: Lamb Kofta Lettuce Boats with Tahini-Lemon Drizzle
meals.description: Seared and broiled lamb koftas served in crisp romaine leaves with a simple cucumber-tomato-mint salad and a tahini-lemon drizzle. Mild, keto-friendly, and ready in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Preheat oven broiler to high. Line a baking sheet with foil and set a rack on top.
Grate onions and squeeze out excess liquid with your hands.
Mince garlic.
Chop parsley and mint.
Halve cherry tomatoes and dice cucumber.
Juice lemon.
Separate romaine lettuce leaves, rinse, and pat dry.
cook_steps: In a bowl, combine lamb mince, grated onions, half the garlic, parsley, cumin, paprika, 1 tsp salt, and black pepper. Mix gently until just combined.
Shape mixture into 12 small oval koftas.
Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Sear koftas 4–5 minutes, turning to brown all sides.
Transfer koftas to the prepared rack and broil 2–3 minutes until cooked through (internal temp 71°C/160°F).
In a small bowl, whisk tahini, lemon juice, a pinch of salt, remaining garlic, and 1 tbsp olive oil until smooth and drizzleable.
In another bowl, toss cucumber, cherry tomatoes, mint, 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper.
Assemble: place 2–3 koftas in romaine lettuce leaves, top with the cucumber-tomato mix, and drizzle with tahini-lemon sauce. Serve immediately.

archetypes.name: Family Low-Sodium American & French Comfort (30–60, Mild)
archetypes.description: Balanced, family-friendly American and French bistro-style dinners with mindful salt control—roasts, braises, and hearty veg sides—cooked from scratch in 30–60 minutes with mild flavors.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a unique low-sodium focus and introduces French cuisine for family diners without overlapping existing heat, equipment, or nutrition profiles.

meals.name: Herb-Roasted Chicken Thighs with Dijon Pan Sauce, Green Beans & Carrots, and 7-Grain Medley
meals.description: Comforting roasted chicken with a bright mustard pan sauce, tender green beans and carrots, and a hearty 7-grain side. Built for low-sodium, family-friendly flavors.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Rinse 1 1/2 cups 7-grain medley under cold water; drain.
Peel and slice 1 onion.
Peel and cut 3 carrots into 1/4-inch coins.
Trim ends from 12 oz green beans.
Mince 4 cloves garlic.
Zest then halve 1 lemon.
Pat dry 6–8 chicken thighs with paper towels; season both sides with black pepper.
Mix 1 tsp thyme and 1 tsp rosemary together.
cook_steps: Combine 7-grain medley, 3 cups water, and 1 bay leaf in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 35–40 minutes until tender. Remove bay leaf and keep covered off heat.

Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high. Add chicken thighs skin-side down; sear 4–5 minutes until golden. Flip, sprinkle mixed thyme and rosemary over the chicken, and transfer skillet to the oven. Roast 20–25 minutes until juices run clear.

While chicken roasts, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a second skillet over medium. Add onion and carrots; cook 5 minutes, stirring. Add 2 tbsp water, cover, and steam 4 minutes. Add green beans and another 2 tbsp water; cover and cook 4–6 minutes until crisp-tender. Season with black pepper and half the lemon zest; keep warm.
Transfer cooked chicken to a plate to rest. Return the oven-safe skillet to medium heat (pour off excess fat, leaving about 1 tbsp). Add garlic; cook 30 seconds.
Stir in 2 tbsp mustard and 1/2 cup white wine; scrape up browned bits. Simmer 2–3 minutes to reduce by half.

Add 1 cup vegetable stock and the juice of half a lemon. Simmer 3–5 minutes until slightly thickened and glossy. Stir in remaining lemon zest and 2 tbsp chopped parsley (optional). Season with black pepper to taste.
Fluff the 7-grain medley with a fork. Plate grains, add green beans and carrots, top with chicken, and spoon pan sauce over.

meals.name: Pork Chops with Apple-Sage Pan Sauce, Roasted Green Beans & Carrots, and Creamy Mash
meals.description: Seared pork chops finished with a mild apple-onion-sage pan sauce, paired with oven-roasted green beans and baby carrots, plus creamy mashed potatoes. Built for low-sodium flavor using herbs, aromatics, and vinegar.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Scrub and peel 2 lb potatoes; cut into 1-inch chunks and place in a pot of cold water.
Trim ends from 12 oz green beans.
Rinse 12 oz baby carrots and pat dry.
Core and thinly slice 2 apples.
Peel and thinly slice 1 large onion.
Finely chop 1 tablespoon sage leaves (or keep whole if preferred).
Pat dry 4 pork chops with paper towels; season both sides with black pepper.
Measure vegetable stock and apple cider vinegar; set out butter, milk, and olive oil.
cook_steps: Start potatoes: Bring the pot to a boil over high heat, then reduce to a simmer and cook until tender, 12–15 minutes.

Roast vegetables: On a sheet pan, toss green beans and baby carrots with 1 tablespoon olive oil, a big pinch of black pepper, and a pinch of garlic flakes if using. Roast until tender and lightly browned, 15–20 minutes, tossing once halfway.
Sear pork: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high. Sear pork chops 2–3 minutes per side until well browned.
Finish pork (optional oven finish): If chops are thick, transfer skillet to the oven for 5–7 minutes until cooked through (internal temp about 145°F). Transfer chops to a plate; tent with foil.
Make pan sauce: Return skillet to medium heat. Add 1 tablespoon butter; sauté sliced onion 3–4 minutes until softened. Add apple slices; cook 2–3 minutes until just tender.

Deglaze: Add 1/4 cup apple cider vinegar; simmer 30 seconds, scraping up browned bits. Add 3/4 cup vegetable stock and chopped sage; simmer 3–5 minutes until slightly thickened and glossy. Season with black pepper to taste. Return pork chops to the pan to warm 1 minute; remove from heat.
Mash potatoes: Drain cooked potatoes well. Return to pot; add 2 tablespoons butter and 1/2 cup milk. Mash until smooth and creamy. Add black pepper to taste.
Serve: Plate mashed potatoes, roasted green beans and carrots, and pork chops. Spoon apple-sage sauce over the chops.

archetypes.description: Fast, family-friendly low-carb dinners built as bowls, lettuce wraps, and protein-plus-veg plates with mild seasoning for easy weeknights.

meals.name: Mild Chicken Shawarma Cauliflower Rice Bowls
meals.description: Family-friendly chicken shawarma bowls over sautéed cauliflower rice with crisp cucumbers, tomatoes, and crunchy romaine. Mild spices keep it kid-friendly and low-carb.
prep_steps: Trim and slice chicken thighs into bite-size strips.
Mince garlic.
Halve cherry tomatoes.
Dice cucumber.
Roughly chop parsley.
Shred or slice romaine lettuce.
Cut lemon in half for juice.
cook_steps: In a bowl, combine olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, ground cumin, paprika, oregano, salt, and black pepper. Add chicken and toss to coat.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken in a single layer.
Cook chicken 5–7 minutes, stirring once or twice, until cooked through and lightly browned. Transfer to a plate.
In the same skillet over medium heat, add a small drizzle of olive oil if needed and the cauliflower rice.
Sauté cauliflower rice 3–4 minutes until hot and slightly tender; season to taste with a pinch of salt and black pepper.
Assemble bowls: add a bed of cauliflower rice, top with chicken, romaine, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, parsley, and a few pickles.
Serve immediately. Optional: squeeze extra lemon over bowls to taste.

meals.name: Mild Beef Taco Lettuce Wraps with Cauliflower Rice
meals.description: Family-friendly ground beef taco filling tucked in crisp lettuce leaves with fresh toppings and a quick cauliflower rice side. Mild seasoning keeps it kid-approved and low-carb.
prep_steps: Rinse and dry lettuce; separate 12 large leaves.
Dice onions.
Mince garlic.
Halve cherry tomatoes.
Chop coriander.
Slice avocado.
Cut lime into wedges.
Have cauliflower rice ready to heat per pack directions.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add onions and cook 3–4 minutes until softened.
Add garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add ground beef; cook 5–7 minutes, breaking it up until browned.
Stir in ground cumin, paprika, oregano, salt, and black pepper; cook 1–2 minutes to season.
Microwave cauliflower rice per pack directions until hot.
Fill lettuce leaves with seasoned beef.
Top with salsa, cherry tomatoes, avocado, and coriander.
Serve with warm cauliflower rice on the side and lime wedges for squeezing.

archetypes.name: Family Skillet Curries & Stir-Fries (Medium Heat, 15–30, Intermediate)
archetypes.description: Stovetop family dinners inspired by Indian, Thai, and Chinese flavors—balanced medium heat curries and stir-fries built in 15–30 minutes with a few coordinated components.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a distinct family option with Medium heat and Intermediate complexity focused on Asian stovetop dishes, filling gaps left by existing Simple/NoHeat/Mild archetypes.

meals.name: Green Coconut Chicken Skillet with Jasmine Rice
meals.description: Family-friendly Thai-Indian green coconut chicken with crisp veggies over fluffy jasmine rice. Medium heat, done on the stovetop in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 1/2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear; drain.
Slice 1 large onion thinly.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Cut 2 bell peppers into strips.
Trim 2 cups green beans; cut into 2–3 cm pieces.
Cut 700 g chicken thighs into bite-size pieces.
Halve 1 lime.
Measure out 3 tablespoons Thai green curry paste, 1 can (400 ml) coconut milk, 1/2 cup chicken stock, 1/2 teaspoon chili flakes, and 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder.
cook_steps: Cook rice: In a pot, add rinsed jasmine rice and 2 cups water with a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and cook 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest covered 5 minutes.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onion and a pinch of salt; sauté 2–3 minutes until starting to soften.
Add garlic; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add chicken thighs; season with salt and black pepper. Sear 3–4 minutes, stirring, until no longer pink on the outside.
Stir in Thai green curry paste and turmeric powder; cook 1 minute to coat the chicken.
Pour in coconut milk and chicken stock; stir to combine and bring to a gentle simmer.
Add bell peppers and green beans; simmer 5–7 minutes until veggies are crisp-tender and chicken is cooked through.
Stir in chili flakes; squeeze half the lime into the skillet. Taste and adjust salt and black pepper.
Fluff rice. Serve curry over rice. Cut remaining lime half into wedges and serve alongside.
Optional: If reheating leftover rice, use a Microwave with a splash of water, covered, 1–2 minutes until hot.

meals.name: Chili-Garlic Chicken Stir-Fry with Basmati Rice
meals.description: Family-friendly medium-heat chicken and vegetables in a glossy chili-garlic sauce, served over fluffy basmati rice. Built fast on the stovetop with pantry sauces—no soy or nuts.
prep_steps: Rinse basmati rice until water runs clear; drain.
Slice chicken thighs into thin strips.
Slice onions; slice bell peppers; slice mushrooms; mince garlic; slice spring onion.
In a bowl, whisk sriracha, rice vinegar, tomato paste, coconut sugar, and chicken stock.
In a separate bowl, toss chicken thighs with cornflour, salt, and black pepper.
Set a large skillet or wok on the stove; gather sunflower oil and a spatula.
cook_steps: Cook basmati rice in a pot with water per pack guidance until tender; keep warm.
Heat sunflower oil in a large skillet or wok over high heat until shimmering.
Add coated chicken thighs in an even layer; sear 3–4 minutes, stirring once, until starting to brown.
Add onions and mushrooms; stir-fry 2 minutes.
Add bell peppers; stir-fry 2 minutes more.
Add garlic; stir 30 seconds until fragrant.
Stir the sauce, then pour it into the skillet; toss to coat and bring to a simmer.
Simmer 2–3 minutes, stirring, until the sauce thickens and chicken is cooked through.
Taste and adjust heat with a little more sriracha if desired; season with a pinch of salt if needed.
Fluff the rice. Serve stir-fry over basmati rice and garnish with spring onion.

Rinse and drain the cherry tomatoes.
Open the salad and place in a serving bowl.
Place rolls in a microwave-safe bowl; set butter on the table.
Set out plates, forks, and serving tongs.
cook_steps: Microwave the beef lasagne ready meal per package directions until steaming hot (typically 6–8 minutes), then rest 1 minute.
Microwave the rolls for 20–30 seconds to soften (or serve at room temperature).
Add cherry tomatoes to the salad and toss.
Plate slices of lasagne with a side of salad and baby carrots.

meals.name: Microwave Roast Chicken Dinner with Green Beans & Garlic Bread
meals.description: Family-friendly heat-and-eat roast chicken with mashed potatoes, quick-steamed green beans, gravy, and warm garlic baguette. Zero chili heat and ready in minutes.
prep_steps: Read package directions for roast chicken, mashed potatoes, gravy, and garlic baguette to confirm timings.
Rinse green beans; trim ends. Place in a microwave-safe bowl with 2 tablespoons water and cover loosely.
Set out a microwave-safe jug or bowl for the gravy.
cook_steps: Microwave the roast chicken per package directions until hot.
Microwave the mashed potatoes per package directions until hot; keep covered.
Microwave the covered green beans for 3–4 minutes until tender-crisp; drain and season with a pinch of salt and pepper.
Pour gravy into the jug and microwave in 30–45 second bursts, stirring between, until hot.
Bake the garlic baguette in a preheated oven per package directions (about 8–10 minutes), or microwave if the package allows; slice.
Plate chicken and mashed potatoes, add green beans, and spoon over gravy. Serve with sliced garlic baguette.

archetypes.rationale: Adds a distinct medium-heat, 30–60 minute intermediate option centered on Turkish and North African cuisines not yet covered, complementing existing simple/no-heat and hot/advanced family archetypes without overlap.

meals.name: Harissa Lamb Kofta with Bulgur Pilaf and Roasted Peppers
meals.description: Juicy harissa-spiced lamb kofta with a tomato bulgur pilaf and oven-roasted peppers, finished with a cool mint yoghurt and sumac.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F).
Rinse 1 1/2 cups bulgur in cold water; drain well.
Finely chop 1 large onion and 3 cloves garlic; divide half for kofta and half for pilaf.
Chop a small handful of parsley and mint; keep separate.
Cut 3 bell peppers into thick strips; toss with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and black pepper.
Zest and juice 1/2 lemon; set aside.
Measure vegetable stock (about 2 1/4 cups).
cook_steps: Roast peppers: Spread bell peppers on a baking tray and roast 18–22 minutes until tender and lightly charred; turn once.
Start pilaf base: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a medium pot over medium heat. Add half the chopped onion and garlic with a pinch of salt; cook 3–4 minutes until translucent.
Add 1 tbsp tomato paste and cook 1 minute. Stir in rinsed bulgur to coat.

Pour in vegetable stock, bring to a simmer, then cover and cook on low for 12–15 minutes until bulgur is tender and liquid is absorbed. Turn off heat, rest covered 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork and fold in chopped parsley and a squeeze of lemon juice.

Make kofta mix: In a bowl, combine lamb mince, remaining onion and garlic, 1 tbsp harissa paste, 1 tsp ground cumin, 1/2 tsp coriander, 1/2 tsp paprika, 1/2 tsp salt, and 1/4 tsp black pepper. Mix gently until just combined.
Shape kofta: With damp hands, form 8–12 oval patties or logs.
Cook kofta: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Sear kofta 3–4 minutes per side until browned and cooked through (internal temp ~70°C/160°F).
Mint yoghurt: In a small bowl, combine yoghurt with chopped mint, lemon zest, a squeeze of lemon juice, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of sumac.
Plate: Spoon bulgur pilaf onto plates, add roasted peppers and kofta. Drizzle mint yoghurt over or serve on the side. Sprinkle a little extra sumac if desired.

meals.name: Turkish-Style Yoghurt Chicken with Saffron Rice and Tomato-Cucumber Salad
meals.description: Oven-roasted yoghurt-marinated chicken thighs with warm spices, served over fragrant saffron basmati rice and a bright tomato-cucumber salad with sumac and lemon.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Finely grate 3 cloves garlic.
Zest and juice 1 lemon; keep separate.
Thinly slice 1 large onion.
Rinse 2 cups basmati rice under cold water until it runs mostly clear; soak 15 minutes, then drain.
Dice 3 tomatoes and 1 cucumber; thinly slice 1/2 red onion; chop a small handful of parsley.
cook_steps: In a bowl, mix yoghurt, grated garlic, lemon zest, 1 tbsp olive oil, 1.5 tsp paprika, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp chili flakes, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
Pat dry chicken thighs and coat with the yoghurt marinade; place on a lined baking tray.
Roast chicken at 220°C/425°F for 25–30 minutes until browned and cooked through (juices run clear). Rest 5 minutes.
While chicken roasts, warm 1 tbsp olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a pot over medium heat. Add sliced onion and a pinch of salt; cook 5–6 minutes until soft.
Stir in drained basmati rice; cook 1 minute to coat. Add a pinch of saffron rubbed between fingers, 2.25 cups water, 1/2 tsp salt, and a pinch of black pepper.
Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest, covered, 10 minutes. Fluff before serving.
For the salad, combine tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and parsley. Toss with 2 tbsp olive oil, 1–2 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp sumac, 1/2 tsp salt, and a pinch of black pepper.
Plate saffron rice, top with chicken, and serve salad on the side. Squeeze extra lemon over chicken if desired.
instructions: Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F.
Finely grate 3 cloves garlic.
Zest and juice 1 lemon; keep separate.
Thinly slice 1 large onion.
Rinse 2 cups basmati rice under cold water until it runs mostly clear; soak 15 minutes, then drain.
Dice 3 tomatoes and 1 cucumber; thinly slice 1/2 red onion; chop a small handful of parsley.
In a bowl, mix yoghurt, grated garlic, lemon zest, 1 tbsp olive oil, 1.5 tsp paprika, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, 1/2 tsp chili flakes, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
Pat dry chicken thighs and coat with the yoghurt marinade; place on a lined baking tray.
Roast chicken at 220°C/425°F for 25–30 minutes until browned and cooked through (juices run clear). Rest 5 minutes.
While chicken roasts, warm 1 tbsp olive oil and 1 tbsp butter in a pot over medium heat. Add sliced onion and a pinch of salt; cook 5–6 minutes until soft.
Stir in drained basmati rice; cook 1 minute to coat. Add a pinch of saffron rubbed between fingers, 2.25 cups water, 1/2 tsp salt, and a pinch of black pepper.
Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest, covered, 10 minutes. Fluff before serving.
For the salad, combine tomatoes, cucumber, red onion, and parsley. Toss with 2 tbsp olive oil, 1–2 tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp sumac, 1/2 tsp salt, and a pinch of black pepper.
Plate saffron rice, top with chicken, and serve salad on the side. Squeeze extra lemon over chicken if desired.

archetypes.name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Spanish & Portuguese Feasts
archetypes.description: Presentation-forward family meals like paella, bacalhau bakes, and peri-peri platters that take time and care for memorable weekend dinners.
archetypes.rationale: Fills the current gap for Family-oriented, 60+ minute Showstopper meals with new Spanish/Portuguese cuisine coverage distinct from existing quick, hands-off, and medium-heat options.

meals.name: Family Chicken & Chorizo Paella
meals.description: A showstopping Spanish-style paella with saffron rice, seared chicken thighs, and smoky chorizo. Built for a family feast with golden socarrat and fresh lemon-parsley finish.
prep_steps: Finely chop onions.
Dice red pepper.
Mince garlic.
Slice chorizo into 1 cm rounds.
Chop parsley; cut lemon into wedges.
Season chicken thighs with salt and black pepper.
Warm chicken stock in a pot; crumble saffron into the stock and keep hot on low.
If using an outdoor grill, preheat to medium and set up a stable surface for the pan.
cook_steps: Set a wide, heavy pan (paella pan or large skillet) over medium heat on the stovetop or grill; add olive oil.
Brown chorizo 3–4 minutes; remove to a bowl, leaving the rendered oil in the pan.
Sear chicken thighs skin-side down until deeply golden, 6–8 minutes; flip and cook 3–4 minutes more. Remove to a plate.
Add onions and red pepper to the pan; cook until softened, 6–8 minutes. Stir in garlic and paprika; cook 30 seconds.
Add diced tomatoes; cook, stirring, until thick and jammy, 3–5 minutes.
Stir in spanish rice to coat in the sofrito, 1 minute.
Pour in white wine; simmer until mostly absorbed, 1–2 minutes.
Add the hot saffron chicken stock and bay leaf; stir once to distribute rice evenly, then stop stirring.
Nestle chicken thighs and chorizo into the rice. Cook uncovered at a steady simmer, rotating the pan occasionally for even heat, about 15 minutes.

Scatter peas over the surface. Continue cooking 10–15 minutes until rice is tender and most liquid is absorbed. For socarrat, increase heat for the last 2–3 minutes without stirring until you hear gentle crackling.
Remove from heat; cover loosely with a clean towel and rest 5–10 minutes.
Discard bay leaf, sprinkle with parsley, and serve with lemon wedges.

meals.name: Portuguese Smoked Hake Bake with Roasted Padrón Peppers
meals.description: A family-size Portuguese-style fish and potato bake in a creamy paprika sauce, finished in the oven and served with blistered Padrón peppers. Weekend showstopper with Spanish and Portuguese flavors.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 200°C (390°F).
Peel potatoes and cut into thin matchsticks (or small cubes).
Thinly slice onions; mince garlic.
Roughly chop parsley; zest the lemon and set aside the zest.
Rinse and dry padron peppers.
Pat smoked hake dry and flake into large pieces, removing any bones.
Warm milk in a small pot with bay leaves until steaming (do not boil); set aside off heat.
cook_steps: Parboil the cut potatoes in salted water for 5 minutes; drain well.
Heat 3 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet (StoveTop). Fry drained potatoes over medium-high heat until lightly golden and just tender, 8–10 minutes; transfer to a large bowl.
In the same skillet, add 1 tbsp olive oil. Cook onions with a pinch of salt over medium heat until soft and lightly golden, 8–10 minutes. Add garlic and 1 tsp paprika; cook 30 seconds.
Deglaze onions with white wine; simmer 1–2 minutes until reduced. Add onions to the bowl with potatoes.
In a clean pot, melt butter over medium heat. Whisk in flour to make a roux; cook 1–2 minutes.
Remove bay leaves from the warm milk. Gradually whisk milk into the roux until smooth. Simmer 3–5 minutes, whisking, until thick and glossy. Season with salt and black pepper.
Fold flaked smoked hake, parsley, and lemon zest into the potatoes and onions. Pour over the hot sauce and gently combine. Adjust salt and black pepper.
Transfer mixture to a greased baking dish. Drizzle 1 tbsp olive oil over the top. Bake (Oven) 25–30 minutes until bubbling and lightly browned.
While the bake finishes, toss padron peppers with 1 tbsp olive oil and a pinch of salt. Spread on a tray and roast 10–12 minutes until blistered, turning once.
Rest the bake 5 minutes. Squeeze lemon over peppers and the bake to taste. Serve hot with extra parsley.

archetypes.name: Family Latin Comfort (Mild, 30–60, Intermediate)
archetypes.description: Family-friendly Latin American and Mexican dinners with gentle seasoning—rice-and-bean plates, enchilada or tortilla bakes, picadillo, and roast-chicken arroz with mild salsas and fresh toppings.
archetypes.rationale: This fills a clear gap by offering mild, intermediate 30–60 minute Latin American/Mexican family meals distinct from the existing extra-hot quick set and hot advanced feasts.

meals.name: Family Arroz con Pollo with Corn
meals.description: A mild, family-style Latin arroz con pollo baked to finish—tender chicken thighs over seasoned tomato rice with corn, coriander, and lime. Optional salsa on the side.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 180°C/350°F.
Rinse and drain the brown rice until water runs mostly clear.
Dice the onions and bell peppers.
Mince the garlic.
Chop the coriander; cut the lime into wedges.
Pat chicken thighs dry and season with salt and black pepper.
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe pot over medium-high heat.
Sear chicken thighs skin-side down until browned, 4–5 minutes; flip and brown 2 minutes more. Remove to a plate.
Lower heat to medium; add onions and bell peppers. Cook until softened, 4–5 minutes.
Add garlic, paprika, cumin, and oregano. Stir 30 seconds until fragrant.
Stir in rinsed brown rice; toast 1 minute, coating grains in oil and spices.
Add crushed tomatoes, chicken stock, corn, bay leaves, and a pinch of salt and black pepper. Stir and bring to a gentle simmer.
Nestle chicken thighs on top (skin-side up). Cover with a tight lid or foil.
Bake at 180°C/350°F for 30–35 minutes, until rice is tender and liquid absorbed.
Rest 5–10 minutes off heat, covered. Remove bay leaves.
Fluff rice around the chicken. Sprinkle coriander and squeeze lime over the top.
Serve with extra lime wedges and salsa on the side (optional).

meals.name: Family Picadillo Tacos with Rice
meals.description: Mild beef picadillo with potatoes, olives, and gentle spices, served in warm taco shells with a side of fluffy rice. Family-friendly and comforting with Latin American/Mexican flavors.
prep_steps: Rinse 1 1/2 cups jasmine rice in cold water until it runs mostly clear.
Peel and small-dice 2 medium potatoes (about 1 cm cubes).
Finely chop 1 large onion.
Seed and small-dice 1 bell pepper.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Roughly chop 1/3 cup olives.
Preheat oven to 160°C/320°F to warm taco shells.
Measure 1 cup beef stock and set aside.
cook_steps: Cook the rice: In a medium pot, combine rinsed jasmine rice, 3 cups water, and a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil, reduce to low, cover, and simmer 12–15 minutes until tender. Rest off heat, covered, 5 minutes, then fluff.
Warm taco shells: Place taco shells on a baking tray and warm in the oven for 5–7 minutes. Keep warm.
Start the picadillo: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and cook, breaking up, 4–5 minutes until browned. Drain excess fat if needed.
Add aromatics: Stir in onions, bell pepper, and a pinch of salt. Cook 3–4 minutes until softened. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Season and build sauce: Stir in 1 tablespoon tomato paste, 1 teaspoon ground cumin, 1 teaspoon oregano, 1 bay leaf, and a few grinds black pepper. Cook 1 minute.

Simmer with potatoes: Add diced potatoes and beef stock. Bring to a simmer, cover, and cook 12–15 minutes, stirring once or twice, until potatoes are tender and most liquid is reduced. If drying too fast, splash in water.
Finish: Stir in chopped olives and 1–2 teaspoons apple cider vinegar. Taste and season with salt and black pepper to preference. Remove bay leaf.
Serve: Spoon picadillo into warm taco shells. Serve with fluffed rice on the side.

archetypes.name: Family Light & Fresh: Japanese and Vietnamese Weeknights
archetypes.description: Lean, veggie-forward family dinners inspired by Japanese and Vietnamese home cooking—brothy soups, rice bowls, and quick stir-fries that stay light yet satisfying.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a nutrition-focused, mild, 15–30 minute family archetype with Japanese/Vietnamese flavors—expanding cuisine diversity while avoiding overlap with existing comfort, hands-off, and spicy sets.

meals.name: Lemongrass Chicken Rice Noodle Soup
meals.description: Light, brothy chicken soup with rice noodles, bok choy, and herbs, scented with lemongrass and star anise. Mild and fresh for an easy family weeknight.
prep_steps: Slice 2 spring onion stalks (greens and whites) and keep some greens for garnish.
Thinly slice 2 carrots.
Slice 6–8 mushrooms.
Chop 2–3 bok choy into bite-size pieces.
Cut 500 g chicken thighs into small 2 cm pieces and pat dry.
Halve 1 onion; smash 2 garlic cloves.
Quarter 1 lime.
Bring a pot of water to a boil for the rice noodles.
cook_steps: Cook rice noodles in boiling water until tender, 4–6 minutes; drain, rinse with cold water, and set aside.
Heat 1 tbsp canola oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion halves (cut side down) and smashed garlic; cook 2–3 minutes until fragrant and lightly browned.
Stir in 1 tbsp lemongrass paste and the sliced spring onion whites; cook 30 seconds.
Pour in 4 cups vegetable stock and 2 cups water; add 1 star anise and 1 bay leaf. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer.
Add chicken thigh pieces; simmer until just cooked through, 8–10 minutes. Skim any foam.
Add sliced carrots and mushrooms; simmer 2 minutes.
Add bok choy; simmer 2–3 minutes until tender-crisp.
Remove onion halves, star anise, and bay leaf. Season broth with salt and white pepper to taste. Squeeze in 2 lime wedges.
Divide rice noodles among bowls. Ladle hot soup over noodles.
Top with chopped coriander, mint, and reserved spring onion greens. Serve with remaining lime wedges.

meals.name: Lemongrass-Lime Chicken Veggie Vermicelli
meals.description: Light rice vermicelli tossed with lemongrass-lime chicken and a colorful vegetable stir-fry. Fresh herbs and citrus keep it bright and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Thinly slice chicken thighs into bite-size strips.
Mince garlic. Slice spring onion. Roughly chop coriander and mint leaves.
Halve lime; finely grate 1 tsp zest and squeeze 2 tbsp juice.
Bring a pot of water to a boil for the rice vermicelli.
Lay out stir-fry vegetables so they’re ready to go.
cook_steps: Add rice vermicelli to the boiling water and cook until just tender (per pack timing, usually 3–5 minutes). Drain and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat.
Add chicken thighs and cook, stirring, until lightly browned on the outside, 3–4 minutes.
Stir in garlic and lemongrass paste; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add stir-fry vegetables and 2–3 tbsp water; toss and cook until crisp-tender, 3–4 minutes.
Season with salt, black pepper, rice vinegar, honey, and lime zest; toss to coat.
Add drained rice vermicelli to the pan; toss gently until noodles are coated and warmed through, 1–2 minutes.
Turn off heat. Add lime juice and most of the spring onion, coriander, and mint; toss.
Plate and top with remaining herbs and spring onion. Serve immediately.

archetypes.name: Family Low-Fat Mediterranean Light Plates (15–30, Mild)
archetypes.description: Lean, veggie-forward Greek/Turkish/Middle Eastern family dinners—grilled or oven-finished lean proteins, herby salads, and brothy legumes with restrained oil and bright citrus.
archetypes.rationale: Introduces a quick, simple, mild, Mediterranean-family archetype with a distinct LowFat focus not yet covered, complementing existing Greek/Middle Eastern entries that are hands-off/no-heat or keto-oriented.

meals.name: Lemon-Oregano Chicken Kebab Bowls with Quinoa and Chopped Salad
meals.description: Quick, low-fat Mediterranean bowls with oven-cooked chicken kebabs, fluffy quinoa, and a bright cucumber–tomato salad. Mild flavors, family-friendly.
prep_steps: Rinse quinoa under cold water in a fine sieve for 30 seconds.
Preheat oven to 220°C/425°F (or broil on high). Line a baking tray with foil and lightly oil it.
Zest half the lemon, then squeeze the whole lemon for juice.
Mince garlic.
Dice cucumber, halve cherry tomatoes, thinly slice red onion, and chop parsley.
Pat chicken kebabs dry with paper towels.
cook_steps: Add quinoa and vegetable stock to a pot. Bring to a boil on the stovetop, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 15 minutes until liquid is absorbed. Rest 5 minutes off heat, then fluff.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, lemon zest, half the lemon juice, oregano, garlic, a pinch of salt, and black pepper. Brush over chicken kebabs.
Place chicken kebabs on the prepared tray. Roast 10–12 minutes (or broil 8–10 minutes), turning once, until cooked through (juices run clear).
In a large bowl, combine cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, parsley, remaining lemon juice, a pinch of salt, black pepper, and sumac (if using). Toss.
Divide quinoa into 4 bowls. Top with chopped salad and chicken kebabs. Serve immediately.

meals.name: Lemony Turkey & Chickpea Skillet with Roasted Zucchini-Tomato over Brown Basmati
meals.description: Lean turkey and chickpeas simmered with lemon, oregano, and sumac, served over brown basmati rice with a side of quick-roasted zucchini and cherry tomatoes. Bright, mild, and family-friendly.
prep_steps: Heat oven to 220°C/425°F and set a rack in the upper third.
Rinse 1.5 cups brown basmati rice under cold water until clear.
Slice 2 medium zucchini into half-moons (1 cm).
Halve 2 cups cherry tomatoes.
Slice 1 large red onion thinly; reserve half for roasting and half for the skillet.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Cut 500 g turkey into small bite-size strips (or crumble if minced).
Chop 1/2 cup parsley.
Halve and juice 1 lemon; reserve zest if desired.
cook_steps: Start rice: In a pot, combine rinsed brown basmati rice with 3 cups vegetable stock. Bring to a boil, then reduce to low, cover, and simmer 20–25 minutes until tender. Rest 5 minutes covered, then fluff.

Roast vegetables: On a sheet pan, toss zucchini, half the red onion, and cherry tomatoes with 1 tbsp olive oil, a big pinch of salt, and a few grinds of black pepper. Roast 12–15 minutes until tender and lightly browned.
Cook turkey: While veg roast, heat 1 tsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high. Add turkey and a pinch of salt and black pepper. Cook 4–5 minutes, stirring, until lightly browned.
Aromatics: Add remaining red onion and the minced garlic to the skillet. Cook 2–3 minutes until softened.
Add legumes and seasoning: Stir in 1 can (about 400 g) chickpeas (drained), 1 tsp oregano, and 1 tsp sumac. Cook 2–3 minutes to warm through.
Brighten: Turn heat to low. Stir in lemon juice (to taste) and most of the chopped parsley. Add 1–2 tbsp water if the skillet looks dry. Adjust salt and black pepper.
Plate: Spoon rice into bowls. Top with turkey–chickpea mixture, then the roasted zucchini and tomatoes. Finish with remaining parsley and optional lemon zest.

Plate: Spoon rice into bowls. Top with turkey–chickpea mixture, then the roasted zucchini and tomatoes. Finish with remaining parsley and optional lemon zest.

archetypes.name: Family Pressure Cooker Express Dinners (15–30, Mild)
archetypes.description: Fast, family-friendly meals built in a pressure cooker/Instant Pot—soups, stews, shredded proteins, and pasta dishes with mild seasoning and balanced flavors.
archetypes.rationale: This fills the uncovered niche of quick (15–30 min) pressure-cooker family dinners—distinct from existing slow-cooker hands-off and air-fryer sets—broadly appealing with mild heat and mainstream American/Italian flavors.

meals.name: Pressure Cooker Creamy Tomato Chicken Orzo
meals.description: Family-friendly orzo with tender chicken in a mild, creamy tomato sauce made fast in the pressure cooker. Comforting American-Italian flavors in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Dice onions.
Mince garlic.
Cut chicken thighs into bite-size pieces and pat dry.
Measure orzo, passata, chicken stock, peas, cream, and parmesan cheese.
Set pressure cooker to Sauté (Normal).
cook_steps: Heat olive oil in the pot.
Add onions and cook 2–3 minutes until softened; add garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Add chicken thighs, salt, pepper, and italian seasoning; stir and sauté 2–3 minutes until lightly seared.
Cancel Sauté. Add orzo, passata, and chicken stock; stir to submerge orzo. Layer peas on top without stirring.
Seal lid and cook on High Pressure for 5 minutes.
Quick release pressure. Open lid and stir well; the mixture will look loose.
Stir in cream and parmesan cheese until melted and creamy. Adjust salt and pepper.
Rest 2–3 minutes on Warm to thicken. Sprinkle basil and serve.

meals.name: Instant Pot American Goulash (Beef & Macaroni)
meals.description: Comforting beef and macaroni in a mild tomato sauce, made fast in the pressure cooker. Family-friendly and ready in about 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Dice onions (about 1 medium).
Dice bell peppers (2 medium).
Mince garlic (3 cloves).
Measure macaroni (12 oz), beef stock (3 cups), and tomato pasta sauce (2 cups).
Set out Italian seasoning, paprika, salt, and pepper.
cook_steps: Set the pressure cooker to Sauté. Add olive oil and ground beef; cook 3–5 minutes, breaking it up until mostly browned.
Add onions, bell peppers, and garlic. Sauté 2–3 minutes until softened. Spoon off excess fat if needed.
Stir in Italian seasoning, paprika, salt, and pepper. Add a splash of beef stock and scrape the bottom to deglaze.
Pour in the tomato pasta sauce and the remaining beef stock; stir to combine.
Add macaroni on top and press down to submerge, but do not stir.
Seal the lid. Cook on High Pressure for 5 minutes.
Quick release pressure. Stir well; let sit 2–3 minutes to thicken.
Taste and adjust salt and pepper. Serve hot.

archetypes.name: Family Quick Grill & Salad Nights (Mild, 15–30)
archetypes.description: Fast, family-friendly grill plates with mild seasoning—quickly seared proteins and veg on the braai paired with simple salads and starch sides for a balanced weeknight dinner.
archetypes.rationale: Adds a missing fast, mild OutdoorGrill-focused weeknight option for families—complementing existing hot/advanced grill feasts and non-grill weeknight sets without overlap.

meals.name: Lemon-Oregano Braai Chicken & Crunchy Greek Salad
meals.description: Fast-grilled chicken thighs with a lemon-garlic-oregano rub, served alongside a crisp tomato, cucumber, olive, and greens salad. Mild, bright flavors for an easy family braai night.
prep_steps: Preheat OutdoorGrill to medium-high heat (200–230°C). If using a grill pan, preheat on StoveTop over medium-high.
Pat dry chicken thighs with paper towel.
In a bowl, combine olive oil, lemon zest, lemon juice, oregano, grated garlic, salt, and black pepper.
Trim and slice cucumber into half-moons.
Cut tomatoes into wedges (or quarter cherry tomatoes).
Thinly slice red onion.
Rinse and dry mixed greens.
Pit olives if needed.
cook_steps: Toss chicken thighs in the lemon-oregano mixture to coat evenly.
Oil grill grates lightly with a paper towel dipped in olive oil.
Grill chicken 6–7 minutes per side, turning once, until juices run clear and internal temp reaches 75°C.
Rest chicken on a plate for 3–5 minutes.
In a large bowl, combine mixed greens, cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, and olives.
Drizzle salad with olive oil and a splash of apple cider vinegar; season with salt and black pepper. Toss to coat.
Slice or serve chicken thighs whole alongside the salad.

meals.name: BBQ Pork Chops with Grilled Corn & Tangy Cabbage Slaw
meals.description: Quick, mild pork chops finished with barbecue sauce, served with charred corn and a crunchy vinegar slaw. Family-friendly and ready off the grill in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Preheat OutdoorGrill to medium-high heat (200–230°C).
In a large bowl, whisk olive oil (2 tbsp), apple cider vinegar, honey, salt, and black pepper for the slaw dressing.
Finely shred cabbage and peel and grate or julienne carrots; add to the bowl but do not toss yet.
Pat pork chops dry; rub with olive oil (1 tbsp), barbecue rub, and a pinch of salt.
Shuck corn; brush lightly with olive oil and season with a little salt.
cook_steps: Place corn on the grill; cook 10–12 minutes, turning every few minutes until lightly charred and tender.
Grill pork chops 4–5 minutes per side until cooked through and lightly charred.
Brush barbecue sauce on both sides of the chops during the last 1 minute of grilling; let glaze set.
Transfer chops to a plate and rest 3 minutes.
Toss cabbage and carrots with the dressing until coated; adjust salt and black pepper to taste. Sprinkle parsley if using.
Serve pork chops with grilled corn and a heap of tangy slaw.

archetypes.name: Family Weeknight Classics (Mild, 15–30 min)
archetypes.description: Balanced, crowd-pleasing dinners for a typical household that cook in 15–30 minutes with straightforward steps and gentle seasoning.
archetypes.rationale: Establishes a mainstream, high-appeal baseline for typical families—fast, simple, mild, and familiar cuisines—forming the backbone before adding specialized diets or adventurous profiles.

meals.name: Oven-Baked Meatballs with Napoletana Spaghetti and Roasted Broccoli
meals.description: Family-friendly spaghetti with warm napoletana sauce, topped with baked beef meatballs and a side of roasted broccoli. Mild, simple, and ready in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F). Line a baking tray with foil or parchment.
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil for the spaghetti.
Cut broccoli into bite-size florets.
Peel and finely chop garlic.
Grate parmesan cheese.
cook_steps: Place beef meatballs on the lined tray. Bake for 12–15 minutes until browned and cooked through, turning once halfway.
On a second section of the same tray, toss broccoli with olive oil, half the garlic, a pinch of salt, and pepper. Roast for 10–12 minutes until tender-crisp.
Cook spaghetti in the boiling water according to package directions until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water, then drain.
In a wide pan over medium heat, warm napoletana sauce with the remaining garlic for 2–3 minutes.
Add drained spaghetti to the pan with the sauce. Toss, loosening with a splash of reserved pasta water as needed. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve spaghetti in bowls, top with baked meatballs, and add roasted broccoli on the side. Finish with parmesan cheese.

meals.name: Sausage & Pepper Penne Skillet with Garlic Butter Ciabatta
meals.description: A family-friendly penne tossed in a mild tomato-basil sauce with sautéed sausages and peppers, served with warm garlic butter ciabatta. Simple, quick, and crowd-pleasing.
prep_steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil for the pasta.
Slice sausages into bite-size rounds.
Slice bell peppers into thin strips.
Peel and finely chop onions.
Peel and mince garlic.
Preheat oven to 200°C/390°F for the garlic butter ciabatta.
Grate parmesan cheese if not pre-grated.
cook_steps: Bake garlic butter ciabatta on a tray until hot and crisp (8–10 minutes); keep warm.
Boil penne pasta until al dente (about 10–11 minutes); reserve 1/2 cup pasta water, then drain.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add sliced sausages and cook until browned (4–5 minutes).
Add onions and bell peppers; sauté until softened (4–5 minutes).
Stir in garlic and italian seasoning; cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in tomato passata with basil; season with salt and pepper; simmer 3–4 minutes. Add a splash of pasta water if sauce is too thick.
Add drained penne to the skillet; toss to coat. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.
Remove from heat and sprinkle with half the parmesan cheese; toss briefly.
Slice the garlic butter ciabatta and serve alongside the pasta. Top pasta with remaining parmesan.

archetypes.name: Family Weekend Advanced: South African Braai & Potjie
archetypes.description: Presentation-worthy South African family feasts built around braai platters and slow potjie or oven bakes with classic sides—hands-on technique, medium heat, and >60-minute cook times.
archetypes.rationale: Fills a clear gap for a South African weekend project in the Advanced, 60+ minute, grill-forward space—distinct from existing simple grill nights and other regional showstoppers.

meals.name: Braai Lamb & Boerewors with Oven-Baked Pap and Chakalaka
meals.description: An advanced South African braai platter of lamb chops and boerewors, served with oven-baked pap and a spicy chakalaka bean-tomato relish. Built for a long, relaxed cook with balanced medium heat.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 180°C (350°F).
Light your outdoor grill for medium-hot direct heat on one side and medium heat on the other.
In a bowl, mix olive oil, braai spice mix, peri-peri spice blend, salt, and black pepper. Rub over lamb chops; coil boerewors and brush lightly with olive oil.
Dice onions and red pepper. Grate carrots. Mince garlic.
Grease a medium baking dish with olive oil. In the dish, whisk maize meal with chicken stock and a pinch of salt until smooth. Cover tightly with foil.
Open baked beans and crushed tomatoes.
cook_steps: Bake the pap: Place the covered baking dish in the oven and bake for 60 minutes. At 30 minutes, carefully remove, whisk or stir to break any lumps, re-cover, and return to the oven.
Start the chakalaka: Set a cast-iron pot or heavy pan on the grill over medium heat. Add olive oil, then onions, carrots, and red pepper. Cook, stirring, until softened, 8–10 minutes.
Add garlic, curry powder, and a pinch of peri-peri spice blend. Stir 1 minute until fragrant.

Stir in crushed tomatoes, baked beans, bay leaf, thyme, and a splash of chicken stock for looseness if needed. Season with salt and black pepper. Simmer uncovered over gentle heat, stirring occasionally, 25–35 minutes, until thick and glossy. Remove bay leaf and adjust seasoning.
Grill the meats: Sear lamb chops over the hot side 2–3 minutes per side to develop color, then move to medium heat and cook to preferred doneness (about 6–8 minutes total for medium). Rest 5 minutes.
Grill the boerewors coil over medium heat, turning occasionally, 12–15 minutes until cooked through and juices run clear. Rest briefly, then slice into chunks.
Finish the pap: Remove from oven, whisk or stir to desired stiffness, and season with a little salt if needed.
Plate: Spoon pap onto a platter, ladle over chakalaka, and arrange lamb chops and boerewors alongside. Serve hot.

meals.name: Oxtail Potjie with Tomato Braise and Chakalaka
meals.description: Slow-braised South African oxtail potjie with a wine-tomato base, finished tender and served with a bright chakalaka side. Built over coals with an oven finish for steady heat.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 160°C (320°F).
Light a medium braai fire and let it burn to steady medium coals.
Pat dry oxtail and season all sides with salt and black pepper.
Peel and slice onion.
Peel and chop carrots into large chunks.
Peel potatoes and cut into large chunks.
Peel and crush garlic.
Open diced tomatoes and beef stock.
Tie thyme and rosemary together if preferred for easy removal.
cook_steps: Set a heavy potjie or Dutch oven over steady coals; add olive oil until shimmering.
Sear oxtail in batches until deeply browned on all sides; set aside on a tray.
Add onion to the pot with a little more olive oil if needed; cook until softened.
Stir in garlic, paprika, cumin seeds, and chilli flakes; cook 30–60 seconds until fragrant.
Deglaze with Chenin Blanc, scraping up browned bits; reduce by half.
Return oxtail and any juices to the pot; add diced tomatoes, beef stock, bay leaves, thyme, and rosemary. Bring to a gentle simmer.
Cover. Option A (braai): Keep over low, steady coals for 2.5–3 hours, maintaining a gentle bubble. Option B (oven): Transfer covered pot to the oven and braise 2.5–3 hours.
After 1.5–2 hours, add carrot chunks; after another 30 minutes, add potato chunks. Stir, re-cover, and continue until oxtail is very tender and potatoes are just cooked.
Uncover for the last 10–15 minutes to slightly reduce. Adjust salt and black pepper to taste; remove bay leaves and herb stems.
Serve hot with chakalaka on the side and scatter coriander over the potjie.
